description: This wine is ripe with generous strawberry flavors and perfumed acidity. A smoky edge accompanies tastes of red cherry. The wine is rounded and light with attractive final acidity.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2017 Beauregard Premier Cru  (Santenay)

description: This is a rich, soft wine with jammy black fruits and ripe tannins. The acidity will hold the wine together and allow it to age. A mineral edge comes from the caillou (stones) in the soil—hence the wine's name. It will age, although quickly, so drink from 2022.
title: Labouré-Roi 2018 Les Cailles Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: A slightly funky lift precedes a very crunchy light palate. There is freshness and frank up-front red-cherry fruit along with ample juiciness. This picnic-style wine will benefit from being served chilled.
title: Domaine Ostertag 2019 Rouge E Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: This wine is ripe and concentrated. It's packed with red fruit while also having solid tannins that give a firm structure. Acidity shoots through at the end to give a fresh lift, although the wine needs to age. Drink from 2021.
title: Domaine Dominique Gruhier 2017 Côte de Grisey  (Bourgogne Epineuil)

description: From Aegerter's own vineyards, this is an initially soft wine. It's only when the background tannins kick in that it becomes firmer, giving a dry, still-young core to this ripe wine. Red fruits dominate, balanced by acidity and a stylish, while firm, aftertaste. Drink from 2021.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2017  Nuits-St.-Georges

description: Aged for 14 months in wood, this wine is perfumed and soft. Red fruits and attractive acidity give a wine that is ripe and almost ready to drink. It comes from the village just north of Gevrey-Chambertin in the Côte de Nuits. Drink from 2021.
title: Derey Frères 2018 Vieilles Vignes  (Fixin)

description: This single-vineyard village wine comes from a small parcel close to woods on the western edge of the Mercurey appellation. With soft red fruits and attractive acidity, the wine is fruity, easy and with a crisp aftertaste. It will be ready to drink from 2022.
title: Château de Santenay 2019 Le Bois de Lalier  (Mercurey)

description: A light and fruity wine with attractive red fruits and acidity. There is just a touch of tannin to hold the friendly fruitiness together.
title: Vignerons de Buxy 2015  Côte Chalonnaise

description: Produced by the Château de Bligny close to Beaune, this soft, perfumed wine has stalky red fruits, laced with a dry core of tannin and fragrant acidity. It could age for another year.
title: Evening Land 2015 Rouge  (Bourgogne)

description: Structured and fruity, this is a wine that shows the delicate perfumed character of the Hautes Côtes. The wine has bright raspberry fruits, balanced acidity and just the right amount of structure for aging for a year.
title: Nuiton-Beaunoy 2015 Les Dames Huguettes  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)
title_short: 2015 Les Dames Huguettes  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)

description: Produced from old vines on the Bourgeois estate, this wood-aged wine certainly shows its toastiness although it also has plenty of red-berry flavors as a balance. It is richly concentrated, a good example of the richer, more serious style of Pinot Noir that is coming from Sancerre. It is structured and can age, so drink from 2021.
title: Henri Bourgeois 2016 La Bourgeoise  (Sancerre)

description: From one of the rare south-facing vineyards in Beaune, this warm, rich and ripe wine is generous with its spice, smokiness and rounded red fruits. Acidity cuts through, bringing raspberry in its wake. The sense of structure really gives this wine its power and density. Drink from 2024.
title: Louis Jadot 2017 Clos des Couchereaux Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: Wonderful spice and ripe red fruits shoot through this rich while structured wine. Dark cherries, strawberries and a ripe texture have given a wine that will be beautiful, smooth and generous. The acidity and the core of tannins will allow it to age well. Drink from 2023.
title: Louis Jadot 2017 Grèves Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: A generous wine, this features intense dark fruits, ripe strawberry and an almost -weet character. It's packed with spice, richness and beautiful concentration. Great acidity gives a wine that is developing freshness and weight. Drink from 2024.
title: Louis Jadot 2017 Les Boucherottes Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: With concentration and a sense of structure, this is a solid wine with great potential. It has firm tannins under the attractive raspberry fruits. The wine is dense and certainly needs aging. Drink from 2022.
title: Roche de Bellene 2016 Vieilles Vignes  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: Coming mainly from the villages of Ladoix and Chorey-lès-Beaune, this wine is a delicious example of the juicy, ripe fruit that comes from the Côte de Beaune. It's soft and open, with a generous character that makes it ready to drink soon, from 2022.
title: Louis Jadot 2018  Côte de Beaune-Villages

description: A touch of flinty reduction clings to the nose but soon relaxes into soft notes of ripe black cherry. The palate is textured and dry, harmonious with fruit and the gentle ripple and crunch of slightly rustic but utterly pleasant tannins. This seems to be its perfect drinking window now: generous with fruit, utterly harmonious and starting to mellow. The finish is fresh, clean and totally moreish. If you can resist at all, this may well continue to develop. Drink now through 2025.
title: Cave de Ribeauvillé 2017 Lieu-dit Kugelberg Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: This is a tangy fruity wine. It has crisp acidity along with spice as well as red-currant fruitiness. It is light and refreshing and ready to drink now.
title: Henri Bourgeois 2020 Petit Bourgeois Rosé de Pinot Noir (Val de Loire)
title_short: 2020 Petit Bourgeois Rosé de Pinot Noir (Val de Loire)

description: This wine is soft and round, with attractive acidity as well as a light sense of structure from tannins. It features considerable acidity along with wild strawberry flavors that keep it lifted and aromatic. Drink from 2021.
title: Louis Latour 2016 Vignes Franches Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: From vineyards across Burgundy, this soft wine is an attractive entry point to the region. It has red fruit and a soft character, with just some youthful tannins that melt as it opens. Drink now.
title: Florent Descombe 2019  Bourgogne

description: This structured wine is young, with a firm character that is still masking the juicy red fruits. However, it does have weight and the potential for a soft, rounded wine in a couple of years. Drink this wine, from a small region just north of Pouilly Fumé, from 2020.
title: Vignobles Berthier 2016 Domaine de Montbenoit Pinot Noir (Coteaux du Giennois)
title_short: 2016 Domaine de Montbenoit Pinot Noir (Coteaux du Giennois)

description: So light in color, this Pinot Noir is almost a rosé. The texture and structure, though, are definitely of a red wine. Firm tannins give a backbone to the red cherry fruitiness and fresh acidity. It's still young so keep this wine until 2020.
title: Vignobles Berthier 2017 Domaine des Clairneaux  (Sancerre)

description: Along with soft red fruits, this is a wine that shows crisp acidity, strawberry flavors and light tannins. It's already drinkable, but it can age for a year.
title: Louis Max 2014 Vigne du Chapitre  (Mercurey)

description: Attractive and fruity, this has red fruits at the fore. It is soft, round and balanced, with just the right amount of red currant acidity. Drink now.
title: Domaine Jessiaume 2013  Bourgogne

description: This is a delicious, fruity wine with just a core of tannins to hold it together. It is packed with red berry fruits along with intense, still-youthful acidity. As it develops, it will become fruitier and softer.
title: Manuel Olivier 2015  Aloxe-Corton

description: With its light color, this is a soft and fruity wine that is now beginning to mature. Its red berries are acquiring a more barnyard character, while acidity is merging into the ripe texture. It's ready to drink.
title: Patient Cottat 2014 Anciennes Vignes  (Sancerre)

description: Notes of red currant, rhubarb, tart strawberry and Cherry Dr. Pepper grace the nose and mouth of this straightforward and easy-drinking red. It's lightweight and softly structured, with a short but clean and pleasant finish.
region_1: Vin de Pays Cité de Carcassonne
title: Laroque 2019 Pinot Noir (Vin de Pays Cité de Carcassonne)
title_short: 2019 Pinot Noir (Vin de Pays Cité de Carcassonne)

description: This ripe wine has spice as well as red-berry fruits. Good acidity combines with light tannins to deliver a balanced wine with a mineral edge that should age for a few more months. Drink from 2021.
title: Domaine Alban Roblin 2018  Sancerre

description: The merest hint of oak spice wafts from the nose. The palate has that softly oaked, spiced roundedness that adds cinnamon and a touch of vanilla to gentle but not overtly expressed berry notes. There is some tannic grip, too.
title: François Baur 2016 Sang du Dragon Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: Intensely perfumed, this wine has soft tannins and a smooth, red-fruit-dominated texture. From a 3.5-acre premier-cru vineyard, it is ripe while light in character, suggesting it will age smoothly and quickly. The wine is almost ready now, although it will be best from 2022.
title: Domaine Ninot 2017 Marissou Premier Cru  (Rully)

description: Named after Alain Thiénot's daughter Garance, this is rich and full of delicious fruit. Well aged, it is just developing some secondary flavors that complement the ripe apple and crisp grapefruit flavors. The mineral tang on the finish adds a bit of levity. Drink now.
designation: Cuvée Garance Blanc de Rouges Brut Millesimé
title: Thiénot 2011 Cuvée Garance Blanc de Rouges Brut Millesimé Pinot Noir (Champagne)
title_short: 2011 Cuvée Garance Blanc de Rouges Brut Millesimé Pinot Noir (Champagne)

description: Faint notes of strawberry rise from the glass; on the palate they become more subdued and meld into fresh, citrusy notes of grapefruit. The combination of fine fizz, grown-up dryness and spiky citrus is absolutely convincing, even mouth-watering.
title: Arthur Metz 2018 Brut Rosé Millesimé Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: With a fine balance between some rigorous tannins and a more generous black-fruit character, this is a wine both to appreciate now and to age. The wine is perfumed, with spice from the wood aging and mint and thyme aromas. This serious wine is just ready to drink, but that would be a shame, so wait until 2022.
title: Domaine Henri Delagrange 2018 Clos de Chênes Premier Cru  (Volnay)

description: This is a solid and balanced wine, with lively aromas and flavors of red cherry, strawberry and banana. Light weight and easy drinking, the softly tannic structure transitions seamlessly into the clean, fruity finish.
title: J.P. Chenet 2019 Reserve Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: A soft and deliciously jammy wine. It has immediately attractive ripe plum and berry fruits, layered with balancing acidity. The tannins sit well in the plump cushion of the wine. Not for aging.
title: Manuel Olivier 2012  Aloxe-Corton

description: The nose just hints at earth and autumnal oak leaf. The palate comes with slight grip, very fine tannins and more earthy leafy aromas. Red-cherry fruit is just hinted at. This is slender and bone dry and will come into its own when served with subtle mushroom or game dishes.
title: Domaines Schlumberger 2019 Les Princes Abbés Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: The nose seems closed. There is just a hint of earthiness. The slender palate has edges of mocha and smoke that frame its fresh crisp tart red-cherry fruit. The body is light but held within a very fine-boned structure that leads to a dry clean finish.
title: Henri Schoenheitz 2018 Saint Gregoire Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: Smooth and soft, this has light, fresh red-berry fruits laced with acidity and perfumed by red cherries. The structure is gentle and with the bright fruits, this succulent wine is ready to drink.
title: Domaines Tatin 2018 Les Demoiselles Tatin Pinot Noir (Reuilly)

description: This wine has an initial strong tannic element that submerges the red fruits. As it opens, the wine reveals more juiciness, berry flavors and fresh acidity. It's still young and needs to be aged. Drink from 2022.
title: Joseph Mellot 2018 Domaine des Emois  (Sancerre)

description: Something of the structure of Morey is here in this wine. However it is surprisingly ready to drink, with the tannins in the background leaving the foreground to juicy red-berry fruits and fresh acidity. It is attractive and balanced; drink now.
title: Louis Chevallier 2018  Morey-Saint-Denis

description: Hints of earth are the only aromas on the nose, which seems devoid of fruit. The palate has a similar leafy earthiness and slight berry aromas. There are bitter edges on the very slender, soft and easy body. This has a picnic-style rusticity about it and a very clean and dry finish.
title: Domaine Sipp-Mack 2019 Tradition Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: With the dominance of Pinot Noir in the Aube region, it is no surprise to find a vintage Champagne that is 100% from that grape. With a round character from the Pinot, as well as a hot vintage, this is a full-bodied wine with vibrant fruit and lively acidity. Drink now.
title: Jean Laurent 2007 Blanc de Noirs Millésime Brut Pinot Noir (Champagne)
title_short: 2007 Blanc de Noirs Millésime Brut Pinot Noir (Champagne)

description: This wine from a densely planted southeast-facing vineyard is still firmly structured with a dry core of tannins. Its black cherry and plum fruit flavors are still developing yet show considerable potential. With its richness, it will age well. Drink from 2024.
title: Philippe Pacalet 2018  Gevrey-Chambertin

description: From the northern end of the Gevrey-Chambertin appellation, this wine is ripe, floral and supple in texture. It has crisp red fruit and vibrant acidity, underpinned by ripe tannins. Developing quickly, it will be ready to drink from 2023.
title: David Duband 2018  Gevrey-Chambertin

description: Light and fruity, this has a fresh red-berry flavor. It has intense youthful acidity, lending a very crisp texture. With its soft tannins, it is ready to drink in a few months when the acidity has calmed down.
title: Domaines Devillard 2014 Le Renard  (Bourgogne)

description: From vines in the plain between Corton and Beaune, this wine is full of ripe red fruits. Its soft, rounded character is spiced with acidity and the wood aging. Soft tannins fill the texture. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Des Meix Porons 2018 Les Pimentiers  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: A Journal is an old Burgundian measurement for just under one acre. From a portion of this Grand Cru vineyard, this wine is perfumed, powerful and has great concentration. Already it is showing dark fruits, ripe plum and good texture. Acidity cuts through the wine, giving a great lift at the end. Drink from 2022.
title: Louis Latour 2018 Les Quatre Journaux  (Romanée-St.-Vivant)

description: For its small size, Morey Saint-Denis is blessed with four Grand Cru vineyards, of which this is arguably the finest. The wine's spice and wood flavors are still evident, although these will get well integrated into the rich red-fruit flavor. It is certainly still young and should not be drunk before 2022.
title: Domaine Coquard Loisson-Fleurot 2018  Clos de la Roche

description: Rich and juicy, this wine holds excellent potential. With its ripe red-berry fruit, balanced tannins and acidity, and spice from the wood aging, it will become a concentrated wine. Drink from 2024.
title: Albert Morot 2018 Les Cent Vignes Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: Situated in the northern part of the Côte de Beaune, the vines produce soft, ripe wines. This wine is typical of this style with just enough tannins to bolster the rich berry fruits. It features a juicy backdrop along with touches of wood and spice. It needs time; drink from 2024.
title: Château de Santenay 2018 Clos du Roi Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: A generous wine, this is packed with red fruits as well as firmly structured. It conveys the fresh acidity of the year, with fine smoky tannins. It will be an impressive wine. Drink from 2024.
designation: Clos de l'Ecu Premier Cru Monopole
title: Domaine Faiveley 2018 Clos de l'Ecu Premier Cru Monopole  (Beaune)
title_short: 2018 Clos de l'Ecu Premier Cru Monopole  (Beaune)

description: A dense, firm selection, this has layers of red fruits and acids that help to give the wine's skeleton some flesh. This is likely to develop into a rich, but always firm, wine.
title: Louis Jadot 2014  Pommard

description: Earthy, soft and ripe, this wine shows the richness of the vintage. It is full of red plum and red jelly flavors, and the tannins are dusty in the background. The acidity holds it all together, and the finish is juicy and fruity.
title: Jaffelin 2013  Volnay

description: Raspberry fruits and juicy acidity are allied to a softly tannic structure to give a ripe while fresh wine. It's fruity but with a firm, dry core that gives the potential to age 2020–2021.
title: Joseph Mellot 2016 Domaine des Emois  (Sancerre)

description: This is a ripe and juicy wine. It has ripe wild strawberry flavors that go with the full-bodied feeling and the warm tannins. It's rich and developing well. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine Roger Belland 2015 Les Charmes  (Santenay)

description: With the next two vintages both damaged by hail, 2016 is the most recent normal crop from Pommard. This structured and solid wine seems to have an excess of wood at this stage, although the ripe red berry fruits do give a more generous character. The tannins, typical of Pommard, kick in—although not enough to spoil the fruitiness. Drink from 2020.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2016  Pommard

description: A massive wine, firmly structured with dense and powerful tannins. This is a wine for long-term aging, with its dark black fruits and chunky feel. It is still just starting out; cellar for 10 years.
title: Camille Giroud 2012 Chambertin  (Chambertin)

description: Dense, weighty and concentrated now, this wine will become opulent once the surface tannins finally integrate. The wine is superrich, with chocolate and licorice partnering with the intense fruit.
title: Domaine de la Pousse d'Or 2013 Corton Bressandes  (Corton-Bressandes)

description: Very ripe, rich, structured wine, exuding power and concentration. It is packed with red fruits and damsons, creating a juicy character and tense mineral acidity. A magnificent wine, for aging.
title: Domaine Jacques Prieur 2012 Corton Bressandes  (Corton-Bressandes)

description: A tight wine, this is dominated by acids, red fruits and firm tannins, and it's missing some of the richness of the vintage. It has a closed feeling, and it needs some months to develop, but this will always be dry.
title: Jaffelin 2013  Chambolle-Musigny

description: A pure startling cherry note rises from the glass. It is flanked by notes of autumn forest, tar and dried orange rind. Evidently, there is some development and evolution here. The palate is alive and fills not only the mouth but all the senses with its alluring aromas, yet it is firmly anchored in earthier tones. The body is svelte and fresh: its fine-boned structure is as much down to fresh acidity as it is to finely flexed tannins. This is profound, lasting and delicious but also deliciously light.
title: Hugel 2015 Grossi Laüe Limited Edition Pinot Noir (Alsace)
title_short: 2015 Grossi Laüe Limited Edition Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: Exhibiting the natural richness of a Chambolle wine, this is a work in progress. Tannins are still integrating with the generous red fruits and acidity to give the ripe and rounded wine it will become. Drink from 2021.
title: Manuel Olivier 2016  Chambolle-Musigny

description: Still young, this is potentially a full and rich wine. It has the structure typical of Morey, with firm tannins and a good depth of cherry and red fruit flavors topped by acidity. The tannins are still firm and the wine needs to age, so drink from 2021.
title: Manuel Olivier 2016  Morey-Saint-Denis

description: This lovely wine, a Monopole, is already showing complex, forward fruit with flavors of plum, cherry and cranberry. Soft and fulsome, it shows a light hand with the oak, allowing nuances of tobacco and leather to emerge. Good weight and texture, it seems bound for early glory.
title: Michel Gros 2003 Clos des Reas  (Vosne-Romanée)

description: Rion holds back on the new oak, letting the pure, supple fruit speak for itself. This is a muscular Vosne, young and firm, showing excellent focus and structure. Already the finish lingers beautifully, with layers of texture and tightly wrapped fruit. Should cellar well for a decade or more.
title: Daniel Rion 2003 Les Beaux-Monts  (Vosne-Romanée)

description: Another premier cru from Michel Gros, this one not as elegant and fruity as the Réas. Instead it goes for more ripeness, more tannic weight, and a lot more roasted scents from the barrels. Big, rawboned but undeniably appealing, it has a lot of rough-hewn flavor, dominated by toast, tannin and tobacco.
title: Michel Gros 2003 Aux Brulees  (Vosne-Romanée)

description: This is a lovely, fragrant Burgundy, with a smoky/cherry scented nose leading into a rather tight, hard young wine. Hints of rosewater, graham cracker and tobacco are there, along with some green tannins. Medium body and texture; needs more time to show its best stuff.
title: Daniel Rion 2003 Clos dea Argillieres  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: Scents of graham cracker and malted milk chocolate tickle the nose, while the tart fruit slowly unwinds to reveal cherry and beetroot scents and flavors. Tannic and hard, without immediately showing much sweetness, it seems to put the emphasis on mineral and soil, root and leaf, but may evolve into a very interesting wine.
title: Michel Gros 2003  Chambolle-Musigny

description: This needs a good bit of breathing time, then it begins to reveal some cherry lifesaver fruit and a balanced structure with firm acids and medium tannins. A bit chalky in the finish, it's a relatively light style that is pleasant and pretty once it has opened up.
title: Michel Gros 2003 Les Chaliots  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: The nose is dominated by the attractive scents of new French oak, with some hints of pipe tobacco and just a whiff of volatile acidity. It is tight and tannic, a bit "lifted" with the VA, and at this point not showing much fruit or complexity, given the price.
title: Daniel Rion 2003 Les Charmes  (Chambolle-Musigny)

description: The wine is structured and with bold red fruits. It also has a firm texture, layers of tannins and a solid texture. Acidity shines through at the end. These elements promise a serious wine that will age well. Drink from 2021.
title: Domaine Jessiaume 2019 Les Ecussaux Premier Cru  (Auxey-Duresses)

description: This ripe, sweet-fruited wine is soft and quite mature. Red fruits have developed into a smooth and round texture with a delicate mushroom character. Drink now.
title: Hugel 2013 Jubiléé Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: Nicely mature, this is a ripe red-fruit and spice-flavored wine. Soft tannins merge with the fruit to give a wine that is balanced with a fragrant, juicy aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Jean-Max Roger 2014 Cuvée La Grange Dimière  (Sancerre)

description: The wine is completely mature. With soft strawberry flavors that have melded into the rounded texture, this is a wine that has only the lightest tannins. Acidity and an attractive ripe fruit character make this a wine to enjoy now.
title: Domaine Julie Belland 2015 Beauregard Premier Cru  (Santenay)

description: Touches of toast and tannin give enough structure. The red berry fruits taste firm and extracted, giving a bitter edge. It's a wine that brings out the structured character of Pinot Noir rather than its fruit.
title: Chavet Fils 2016 Cuvée Exception  (Menetou-Salon)

description: Rich, packed with  juicy fruit. The wine has weight, depth of fruit flavor and tannins as a central core. A smoky character indicates the wood aging, packing in with the acidity and black cherry fruits on the finish. Age for 5–8 years.
title: Maison Jessiaume 2012  Clos de Vougeot

description: Light and fruity, this wine has red fruit and a tannic edge, and bright acidity that gives definition to the fruit. Ready to drink now.
title: Joseph Faiveley 2014  Bourgogne

description: The Burgundy-based producer has made a fresh, cherry-flavored wine that is identifiably Pinot Noir. It has soft tannins and a dry core, yet is dominated by red fruit and acidity on the finish. Drink now.
title: Patriarche Père et Fils 2019 Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: Despite its power, this is so elegant, showing tannins, minerality and generous flavors of black fruits, dark chocolate and spices. The smooth and rich surface belies the inner taut texture, showing how the wine will need many years to finally come round.
designation: Chambertin Clos de Bèze Grand Cru
title: Domaine Perrot-Minot 2014 Chambertin Clos de Bèze Grand Cru  (Chambertin Clos de Bèze)
title_short: 2014 Chambertin Clos de Bèze Grand Cru  (Chambertin Clos de Bèze)

description: The small Mazoyères-Chambertin Grand Cru creates structured wines with plenty of texture and tannins. This is brooding, firm and very concentrated, with its fruit set way behind the dark tannins and spice note. It will take at least 10 years to start to mature.
title: Domaine Perrot-Minot 2014  Mazoyeres-Chambertin

description: Very structured and firm, this has the weight, richness and power that is typical of Echézeaux. It's the tension between the tannins and the ripe black fruits that give this wine its great aging ability and depth of flavor. It needs at least six years.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2014  Echézeaux

description: This is a smooth, rich wine with just the right amount of tannic structure and wood flavors to add complexity. It has density along with red berry and black-cherry fruits that are lifted by acidity. It's a wine for aging, so don't drink before 2022.
title: Domaine Vincent Pinard 2018  Sancerre

description: From the northernmost appellation of the Côte de Nuits, this firm and solidly tannic wine comes from one of the vineyards on the list to get Premier Cru approval in the near future. Its tannins are well balanced already with the red-berry fruit and bitter-cherry flavors that are shot through with acidity. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Huguenot 2017 Champs-Perdrix  (Marsannay)

description: This is a blend from different Premier Cru vineyards in Beaune. At this stage, it is dominated by the wood aging. That gives a bitterness to the wine that needs to soften and allow the ripe fruit to come out. It does have potential, although the maturity will take time. Drink from 2023.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2019 Collection Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: A fruity style of wine, this has red berry flavors and only touches of structure and tannin. The wine is warm and round, packed with fruit on the finish.
title: Domaine Sylvain Pataille 2014  Marsannay

description: This attractively perfumed wine shows the structure of Pommard without pushing too strongly. It has ripe red plum and cherry fruit that will balance the tannins as it ages. Drink from 2024.
title: Labouré-Roi 2019  Pommard

description: This is a tangy fruity wine. It has crisp acidity along with spice as well as red-currant fruitiness. It is light and refreshing and ready to drink now.
title: Henri Bourgeois 2020 Petit Bourgeois Rosé de Pinot Noir (Val de Loire)
title_short: 2020 Petit Bourgeois Rosé de Pinot Noir (Val de Loire)

description: Nuits Saint-Georges is the home of the Aegerter family and its Domaine. This ripe spicy smoky wine is rich both from the vintage and from the core of tannins that are typical of the appellation. It is a smooth rounded wine although it will need some aging. Drink from 2024.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2019 Domaine Aegerter  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: While the producer does have vines in Volnay, this wine comes from the negociant side of the business. The wine has structure and some firm tannins. At this stage, the Volnay roundness lies behind the dry surface. But it does have weight and the potential to age well. Drink from 2021.
title: Maison Jessiaume 2019  Volnay

description: The acidity is most obvious at this stage of the wine's development. It does have structure, but it feels cool and tight. A green edge at the back adds to the cool character.
title: Louis Jadot 2015 Le Vaucrain  (Côte de Nuits-Villages)

description: Smooth and softly textured, this is an attractive red wine. It has ripe berry fruits, gentle tannins that are enough to bring out the wood and spice flavors. Give the wine two years.
title: Roger et Didier Raimbault 2014  Sancerre

description: The wine is structured and still firm, showing tight tannins and acidity over the red fruits. A cool edge elicits the fresher character of the fruits. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine Jean Petitot et Fils 2015 Les Vignottes  (Côte de Nuits-Villages)

description: This fruity wine features strawberry and bitter cherry flavors. A lightly tannic structure accompanies a very fragrant and smoky character. Wood shows through at the end. Drink from 2019.
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2016 Réserve  (Bourgogne)

description: This small domaine in the Mâcon region has produced a soft, ripe wine with attractive strawberry fruits. It's rounded, with just light acidity over the fruit flavors. At the end, it feels warm and ripe. Drink now.
title: Domaine Olivier Merlin 2015  Bourgogne

description: A rounded wine, this is a blend of different premier-cru vineyards in Beaune. It packed with raspberries and red cherries. The acidity, typical of the year, is restrained here by the ripe fruitiness. Tannins give the wine just the right amount of support.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2017 Bastion Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: With structure and some firm tannins, this wine is on the dry side. It has black fruits that will develop over time, and certainly show now with a juicy background. The acidity is refreshing even through the solid tannins. Drink from 2024.
title: Albert Bichot 2018 Les Evocelles  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: A wine that reveals its rich, jammy fruit slowly. When it arrives, the fruit is soft and generous, with strawberry jam and red plum flavors. It also has intense fresh acidity, a dry tannic core and aging potential.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2013  Côte de Beaune-Villages

description: Soft and generous, full of perfumed ripe berry fruits, touched with strawberry acidity. The tannins are all part of the softness, like flecks of dust on the wine. It is beautifully pure, ripe and open.
title: Domaine de la Vougeraie 2009 Les Marconnets Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: A charged Burgundy, packed with dense tannins and powerful ripe black berry fruits. There's a delicious tension here between the fruits and the tannin, pushing the acidity, the red plums and strawberries forward, but keeping them in check. At this stage, it needs decanting; otherwise keep for 2–3 years.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2009  Gevrey-Chambertin

description: There is a sense of extraction and long wood aging with this bitter, chocolate-flavored wine. The palate has a dark plum-skin fruit character and a dry, hard-edged core. It will need at least six years to mature.
title: Manuel Olivier 2014 Premier Cru  (Pommard)

description: Vines planted between 900 and 1,200 feet above sea level give this cool interpretation of Pinot Noir. The wine is crisp, lightly structured with some tannins and with a delicate cherry and red-berry fruitiness. It will be ready to drink from 2021.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2018  Hautes Côtes de Nuits

description: From vineyards at the south end of the Côte de Nuits, this is a fruity, crisp wine with attractive ready-to-drink fruit flavors. The aftertaste is tight and packed with acidity.
title: Louis Latour 2018  Côte de Nuits-Villages

description: With some tannins and with bright red fruits, this wine is structured and has attractive acidity. A perfumed wine with a fruity future, it will be ready to drink from 2022.
title: Louis Latour 2018  Marsannay

description: A structured, tannic wine, this has dark fruits and a solid, dense character that's freshened by the acidity. The wood aging is still showing with toasty, spicy flavors. These need to be further integrated into the wine as it ages, so wait to drink until 2022.
title: Domaine Matthias et Emile Roblin 2018 Grande Côte de la Vallée  (Sancerre)

description: This wine is dense and still firm, although the red-berry fruits are being to integrate well into the structure. It shows signs of its wood aging that will need to go away for the wine really to develop. However, a juicy background promises well. Drink this wine, from a small Grand Cru close to the village of Aloxe-Corton, from 2024.
title: Au Pied du Mont Chauve 2016 Clos des Fietres  (Corton)

description: This is a smooth wine with soft tannins cushioned by generous fruits. Its red-cherry acidity gives the lightest stalky edge and will allow the wine to age further. The partial barrel aging has added spice. Drink this fine wine from 2023.
title: Domaine de l'Hermitage 2019 Les Pierres Chaudes  (Menetou-Salon)

description: The red wine from this vineyard (which also produces a white) is firm with layers of toast from wood aging as well as the potential for ripe red fruits. It is going to need some time to lose that spicy flavor that currently dominates the wine. Give it until 2021.
title: Domaine Jessiaume 2019 Les Gravières Premier Cru  (Santenay)

description: This aromatic wine is delicious Pinot Noir. With fine ripe red fruits that are shot through with tannins for aging and crisp acidity for refreshing drinking, this is a rich wine that should be drunk now.
title: Domaine Michel Goubard 2019 Mont-Avril  (Côte Chalonnaise)

description: With vineyards south of the Michelin tire city of Clermont-Ferrand, this producer is on the edge of the volcanoes of the Puy de Dôme. The wine, lightly fruity with fresh wild-berry flavors, is soft and fruity, ready to drink young. Just wait until early 2022.
title: Domaine Sauvat 2019 Nymphéa Pinot Noir

description: Ripe with a core of dry tannins, this is a typical foursquare Nuits-Saint-Georges. Structure gives shape to the black fruits and acidity that are developing well. Already in balance, it will be drinkable from 2020.
title: Manuel Olivier 2015  Nuits-St.-Georges

description: Enticingly perfumed, this is full of red cherry and plum fruits that are cut through with intense acidity. A dry core of tannins both gives support and promises aging. Structured while packed with fruit, it should be drunk from 2021.
title: Manuel Olivier 2016  Aloxe-Corton

description: This wine has benefited from the warm vintage. It's ripe with attractive cherry fruit and a touch of spice from wood aging. It will be ready to drink from 2022.
title: Nuiton-Beaunoy 2019 Grande Cuvée  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Beaune)
title_short: 2019 Grande Cuvée  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Beaune)

description: Powerful, with tannins that are seamlessly woven into the fruitiness, this is a rounded, ripe and concentrated wine. The berry fruits and the juicy damsons are as important as the generous, soft texture. The wine will develop over the medium-term; drink from 2021.
title: Manuel Olivier 2015  Clos de Vougeot

description: Based in Nuits Saint-Georges, Manuel Olivier understands the appellation well. That is shown in this bottling that manages to combine the structure of a Nuits wine with dark fruits and a juicy texture. It's rich while also firm. Drink from 2021.
title: Manuel Olivier 2016  Nuits-St.-Georges

description: While there are still plenty of firm tannins, the wine also is now showing its red berry fruits and enticing texture. Great acidity cuts through the structure, giving freshness to the naturally dense character of this Grand Cru wine. It's for aging, but not for too long, so drink from 2021.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2015 Corton Vergennes Grand Cru  (Corton Vergennes)

description: Well structured, this combines ripe red fruits with a firm texture. It has a good concentration and a mineral, terroir-driven character that shows through in its dry core. The juicy acidity at the end gives a lift, but the wine needs to age. Drink from 2021.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2016 Bélissand Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: Every Burgundy merchant seems to have a Clos de Vougeot. The Aegerter's version is relatively light, as much fruit as tannins even while it is young. Berry fruits comes forward, while the layer of tannin is in a supporting role. It's a solid wine, not one that has a long future. Drink from 2022.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2016  Clos de Vougeot

description: With its bitter cherry flavors and light, smoky tannins, this perfumed wine has a richer juicy element in the background. Lightly textured, it's more about fruit that is up front and refreshing. Drink now, although the wine will be better from 2021.
title: Denis Jamain 2018 Pinot Noir (Reuilly)

description: This firm wine fits well with the image of Pommard. A tannic core contrasts with the potential of the red cherry fruits. Wood aging is still prominent, and the wine needs time to balance out. Drink from 2021.
title: Manuel Olivier 2016 Premier Cru  (Pommard)

description: This wine is soft and round, with attractive acidity as well as a light sense of structure from tannins. It features considerable acidity along with wild strawberry flavors that keep it lifted and aromatic. Drink from 2021.
title: Louis Latour 2016 Vignes Franches Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: Firm, structured and solid, this is a smoky, ripe wine with attractive acidity, red berry fruit and good concentration. It is developing slowly, with a solid structure and fine acidity. Drink from 2021.
title: Domaine Claude Nouveau 2015 Les Charmes Dessus  (Santenay)

description: This ripe and fruity wine comes from Faiveley's wholly-owned vineyard in Mercurey. A touch of tannin gives structure to the cherry fruits and ripe acidity. It's a rounded wine to drink now, but better to age until 2019.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2015 Clos de Myglands Premier Cru  (Mercurey)

description: The wine has the firmness of a Pommard along with ripe fruits full of sweetness and acidity. That makes it structured and with a good future, while being totally fruity at the same time. Drink from 2019.
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2015  Pommard

description: This pleasantly perfumed wine has some acidity, jammy red fruits and soft tannins. It feels very rounded and smooth, with a structure that is totally integrated into the velvet texture. Drink from 2020.
title: Joseph Faiveley 2015 Les Charmes Premier Cru  (Chambolle-Musigny)

description: Ripe, soft red cherry fruits are linked to a light texture and soft tannins in this ready-to-drink wine. The final acidity brings out the attractive fruitiness of this fresh wine. Drink now.
title: Jean Reverdy et Fils 2017 Les Villots  (Sancerre)

description: Showing some of the richness and structure of Vosne-Romanée, this is a concentrated wine, spiked with wood aging while also full of dark plum fruits. It is still integrating, bringing the spice from the wood more into balance. Drink from 2019.
title: Domaines Devillard 2015 Domaine des Perdrix  (Vosne-Romanée)

description: With the next two vintages both damaged by hail, 2016 is the most recent normal crop from Pommard. This structured and solid wine seems to have an excess of wood at this stage, although the ripe red berry fruits do give a more generous character. The tannins, typical of Pommard, kick in—although not enough to spoil the fruitiness. Drink from 2020.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2016  Pommard

description: A cherry-fresh wine that's so full of fruit that its structure becomes secondary. A dry edge of tannin supports the fruit and acidity, making this wine so drinkable now.
title: Domaine de l'Hermitage 2016  Menetou-Salon

description: Sourced from grapes grown in the Côte Chalonnaise, this is a soft, red-fruit-flavored wine, with a ripe, jammy character that makes it almost sweet. It is ready to drink.
title: Château de Santenay 2018 Vieilles Vignes  (Bourgogne)

description: This is a light-colored wine, with structure and acidity to balance the perfumed cherry-flavored fruit. Still young, still developing its fruitiness, the wine is going to be crisp with attractive strawberry flavors and soft tannins. Drink from 2023.
title: Domaine Chevillon-Chezeaux 2018 Aux Champs Perdrix Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: From vines situated just under the line of great Grand Cru vineyards, this is a structured wine. It is surprisingly under-powered for the appellation, although its balance is just right. So firm black-plum skins balance a combination of tannins and black-cherry fruits that are topped with acidity. Drink from 2024.
designation: Domaine des Perdrix La Perrière Premier Cru
title: Domaines Devillard 2018 Domaine des Perdrix La Perrière Premier Cru  (Gevrey-Chambertin)
title_short: 2018 Domaine des Perdrix La Perrière Premier Cru  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: Stéphane Brocard is based in Marsannay the northernmost vineyard in Burgundy's Côte d'Or. This wine comes from two small parcels with 35-year-old vines. It is already fruity and attractive, although the tannins do promise aging. Crisp with the pure acidity of the vintage, it will develop well and should be drunk from late 2021.
title: Maison Stéphane Brocard 2018 Closerie des Alisiers Vieilles Vignes  (Marsannay)

description: Crunchy fresh notes of red cherry dominate aromatically. The palate is light, juicy, crisp and very refreshing. This is rustic and ready, but also full of charm with its animating red fruit. The finish is dry and invigorating.
title: Kuentz-Bas 2019 Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: Scents of ripe red berry and cherry fruits are upfront on the nose of this friendly red, with hints of sweet spice, cherry cola, plum sauce and tree bark adding depth and interest. Lightweight and easy drinking, it boasts silky tannins and a fresh-fruited palate. Drink now.
title: Maison Nicolas 2019 Pinot Noir (Pays d'Oc)

description: While the wine does have some dry tannins, it is surprisingly light and soft for a Nuits-Saint-Georges. Red cherry flavors are already as important as the acidity and the dry core. That means this is not a wine for long-term aging, so drink from 2021. This is one of the first vintages since Labouré-Roi, which was hit by scandal in 2016, passed into new ownership.
title: Labouré-Roi 2017  Nuits-St.-Georges

description: Louis Max has a particular affinity with the Côte Chalonnaise and this structured and firm wine shows good judgment. With acidity and a mineral element along with the fragrant berry fruits, the wine is ready to drink, although it will be better from 2020.
title: Louis Max 2017 Côte Chalonnaise  (Bourgogne)

description: Light fruit, dwelling on bitter cherry and fresh raspberry flavors. The wine shows crisp acidity, tight tannins and a cool feel.
title: Pierre Morey 2011  Bourgogne

description: Moderately intense on the nose with dominating earthy, forest floor notes backed by red plum guts and cherry along with a hint of vanilla ice cream with raspberry sauce swirled in. Dusty tannins flesh out the palate and the finish offers some mild black pepper spice.
title: La Forge Estate 2012 Unfiltered Pinot Noir (Vin de Pays d'Oc)
title_short: 2012 Unfiltered Pinot Noir (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: There is a distinct tannic edge to this 100% Pinot Noir Champagne. It gives a firm character and with spice as well as red fruits and citrus. These elements, not quite integrated, show the wine needs to age further. Drink from 2023.
designation: Cuvée Royale Blanc de Noirs Brut Nature
title: Joseph Perrier 2013 Cuvée Royale Blanc de Noirs Brut Nature Pinot Noir (Champagne)
title_short: 2013 Cuvée Royale Blanc de Noirs Brut Nature Pinot Noir (Champagne)

description: Named after the daughter of owner Alain Thiénot, this elegant Champagne from grapes grown on the Montagne de Reims is just reaching maturity. It shows structure as well as ripe white fruits, with a citrus background. Drink now.
title: Thiénot 2012 Cuvée Garance Pinot Noir (Champagne)

description: There are plenty of dry tannins here, dominating light red berry and hedgerow fruits. It is never going to be a big wine, but the tannins should soften in a year to leave a fresh, fruity wine.
title: Domaine Jayer-Gilles 2011  Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits

description: This is a crisp fruity wine, full of red-berry fruits and acidity. It has the vintage's rich character, juicy and with a core of tannins that will soften quickly. Drink from 2024.
title: Domaines Devillard 2019 Château de Chamirey  (Mercurey)

description: In the rush for white wines, it is sometimes forgotten that Chassagne-Montrachet once produced more red than white. This soft perfumed wine shows the generous nature of the wines from this appellation with red-cherry flavors coming from the Pinot Noir. Rich, soft and fruity, the wine will be ready from 2022.
title: Florent Descombe 2018  Chassagne-Montrachet

description: Vines planted in the 1960s give this wine its great concentration. With its powerful fruits and dense tannins, it is well structured, with the hallmark bright fruits of the vintage along with acidity. The tannins are very present at the moment, and the wine will need long aging. Drink from 2024.
title: Domaine Jacques Prieur 2018  Chambertin

description: Powerful and structured, this wine is dark with black fruits. The rich fruit and acidity are surrounded by firm tannins provide a solid scaffolding. With acidity and tannins at the end, this complex wine will age slowly, so don't drink before 2022.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2017  Charmes-Chambertin

description: This dense and complex wine comes from one of the magnificent Grand Cru vineyards in Morey Saint-Denis. It is a powerful wine with its rich, generous fruit and dense tannins. It has everything larger than life: big fruit, big tannins and a big future. Drink this exceptional wine from 2024.
title: Albert Bichot 2018  Clos de la Roche

description: This wine is dense and severely tannic. It has dense ripe-fruit flavors as well, although they are buried under the power of the structure. For a wine of such impressive character that is not a bad thing, it just indicates that it needs time to mature and will age well. Drink from 2023.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2017  Chambertin Clos de Bèze

description: This wine is concentrated and dense. Big tannins flow up through this wine, giving shape to the ripe black fruit. In the back, acidity dominates bright red berries and the potential for a rich, generous future. The wine will age over many years. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2018  Mazis-Chambertin

description: Big, ripe and smoky, this wine is generous while having great freshness. It's packed with fresh strawberries and raspberries along with powerful tannins. The combination of structure and great fruit will allow this wine to age. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2018  Chambertin Clos de Bèze

description: Produced from vines mainly planted in the 1970s, this is a concentrated dark wine. Rich and ripe, it has powerful tannins mingled with beautifully perfumed fruits. The wine is dense and packed with floral fruitiness as well as fine, sweet tannins. Drink from 2025.
title: Domaine Jacques Prieur 2018  Musigny

description: Firmly structured, this dark wine has smoky tannins and intense acidity combined in a texture that is dusty, almost dry at the core. Over this the ripe red fruits are spread thickly, giving a powerful concentrated wine that will age well. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2018  Echézeaux

description: Ripe and full of red berry aromas and flavors, this is a generous, warm wine. It has great swathes of juicy acidity and an attractive touch of toasty, spicy wood that is integrating well with the fruit. The tannic structure offers good support for the bright acidity and rich fruitiness. Drink from 2024.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2017 Bressandes Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: Beautifully perfumed in a relatively light style, this Santenay is full of red fruits, sweet tannins and mouthwatering acidity. It has some richness, although the main character is of freshness.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2012 Santenay-Beauregard Premier Cru  (Santenay)

description: Named after David Moreau's mother, Simone, this old-vine wine is concentrated, with sweet-tasting fruit and spicy tannins. The tight acidity gives a delicious lift to the red berry flavors.
title: David Moreau 2014 Cuvée S  (Santenay)

description: Fruity and fragrant, this Savigny shows extra weight that makes it serious and age worthy. The wine's tannins are cushioned by the generous red fruits, which promise aging potential. Wood and spice flavors emphasize the finish.
title: Louis Jadot 2014 Clos des Guettes Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: A very structured wine that seems ready for aging. Its tannins are still firmly present, lying over the dark black fruit. Acidity gives the wine a rich, juicy finish.
title: Roux Père et Fils 2011 Les Valozières  (Aloxe-Corton)

description: Soft fruit, with a tannic hint underneath. The wine is supported at this stage by wood, while the fruit has strawberry jam sweetness. The acidity and structure really only come through at the end.
title: Alex Gambal 2013 En Chevret  (Volnay)

description: This wine is round, opulent and beautifully perfumed., with a structure smoothed by the ripe fruits and generous texture. Acidity and a fresh aftertaste bring out cherry flavors and leave a bright aftertaste. Drink from 2021.
title: Alex Gambal 2017  Volnay

description: A blend of grapes from different growers, this is a structured, firm wine. It has a core of drying tannins as well as the bright fruitiness of the vintage. As it develops, that fruit will grow richer and fuller yet always maintaining a crisp edge. Drink from 2023.
title: Louis Jadot 2018  Pommard

description: There is a distinct tannic edge to this 100% Pinot Noir Champagne. It gives a firm character and with spice as well as red fruits and citrus. These elements, not quite integrated, show the wine needs to age further. Drink from 2023.
designation: Cuvée Royale Blanc de Noirs Brut Nature
title: Joseph Perrier 2013 Cuvée Royale Blanc de Noirs Brut Nature Pinot Noir (Champagne)
title_short: 2013 Cuvée Royale Blanc de Noirs Brut Nature Pinot Noir (Champagne)

description: This has soft red fruits along with a firm structure of tannins and acids. Shapely and balanced, this is ready to drink now.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2014 Le  (Bourgogne)

description: This blend of four parcels from different premier crus is structured with all the density of this fine village. Its black fruit gets a fresh edge of acidity, while the tannins are firm and tight. The wine needs to age and will be best from 2022.
title: David Duband 2018 Les Broc Premier Cru  (Morey-Saint-Denis)

description: The wine is light in color and light in body. Red cherry fruits give freshness, although there is a burnt aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Vieil Armand 2016 Tradition Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: A sumptuous wine from a vintage that is fruity and generous. It does show some of the structure of the appellation, but the juicy cherry and ripe strawberry flavors dominate. It's going to develop into a rich and early-maturing wine. Drink from 2021.
title: Manuel Olivier 2015 Les Damaudes  (Vosne-Romanée)

description: Already beautiful and rich, this has power, concentration and many layers of ripe berry fruits. Red plums also come through strongly, bringing in juicy acidity. This dense and muscular wine should age. Drink from 2021.
title: Manuel Olivier 2016  Gevrey-Chambertin

description: From a small parcel called Les Mazières Basses, this is a rare Village wine in an area packed with Premier and Grand Crus. It has power and richness as well as a smooth texture that is already velvety. It's ripe and concentrated, with juicy black currant and berry fruits, finishing dry and firm. Drink from 2022.
title: Manuel Olivier 2016  Vosne-Romanée

description: The steep, stony slope of the Cul de Beaujeu has produced this firmly structured wine that has rich plum and berry fruits. It is an impressive wine, ripe and juicy. With plenty of youthful crisp freshness the wine needs to age to plumb the depths that are there for the future. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Delaporte 2018 Cul de Beaujeu  (Sancerre)

description: The richness and structure of the appellation are well represented in this firm wine. It has dark tannins and hints of wood aging as well as ripe black cherry and berry fruits. With its structure and intense acidity, the wine will age well. Drink from 2024.
title: Nicolas Potel 2018  Morey-Saint-Denis

description: Ripe, jammy fruitiness gives this wine a generous feel. Packed with opulent berry flavor, it will develop well. It is rich and rounded, nicely supported by the tannins that are in the background. Drink from 2023.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2017 Clos de Marconnets Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: This is produced from 25-year-old vines in the Chambertin Grand Cru vineyard. It is a smoky, structured wine with layers of dark fruits and ripe tannins, with the fresh acidity of the year. Lots of attractive fruit is surrounded by the firm tannins and dry aftertaste. It should not be drunk before 2024.
title: Domaine Jacques Prieur 2018 Premier Cru  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: From the northern end of the Gevrey-Chambertin appellation, this wine is ripe, floral and supple in texture. It has crisp red fruit and vibrant acidity, underpinned by ripe tannins. Developing quickly, it will be ready to drink from 2023.
title: David Duband 2018  Gevrey-Chambertin

description: This is a fine wine that performs at the level of a premier cru. It has brambly fruitiness and intense perfume. The structure is already finely integrated, allowing the strawberry fruit and acidity to shine through. Drink from 2023.
title: David Duband 2018  Morey-Saint-Denis

description: This has both a rich structure and rich fruit. The tannins comes first, dark and concentrated with spice and a dry core. After it, the ripe and juicy black fruit is layered with dense acidity. Together these two elements make for a concentrated wine that will age. Drink from 2024.
title: Albert Bichot 2018 Domaine du Clos Frantin  (Vosne-Romanée)

description: Ripe and juicy, this is a wine with structure and fine, dusty tannins that give it density. The red fruit is juicy, perfumed and has the freshness of the vintage, bright and forward. The underlying tannins are concentrated and will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2024.
designation: Domaine du Pavillon Clos des Maréchaudes Premier Cru
title: Albert Bichot 2018 Domaine du Pavillon Clos des Maréchaudes Premier Cru  (Aloxe-Corton)
title_short: 2018 Domaine du Pavillon Clos des Maréchaudes Premier Cru  (Aloxe-Corton)

description: This austere wine offers some firm tannins over the red fruit. It has acidity, red-currant fruit and a core of dryness, typical of young Pommard, that suggests it will age well. Drink from 2024.
designation: Domaine du Pavillon Les Rugiens Premier Cru
title: Albert Bichot 2018 Domaine du Pavillon Les Rugiens Premier Cru  (Pommard)
title_short: 2018 Domaine du Pavillon Les Rugiens Premier Cru  (Pommard)

description: This wine is soft and fruity, with a smoky touch that adds interest. Red-cherry flavors and balanced acidity allow easy accessibility. The wine, with its gentle texture, is ready to drink.
title: Nicolas Idiart 2018 Pinot Noir (Val de Loire)

description: The wine is ripe, full of black-cherry fruits and with a substantial tannic core. At the same time, it does have the lighter style normally associated with red Pinot Noir. The aftertaste is ripe, fruity and rich with fruit. Drink from 2022.
title: Paul Prieur et Fils 2019  Sancerre

description: One year of wood aging has given this wine its toasty character. It is balanced with the red-cherry fruit and acidity. Named after the constable who controlled the castle of Sancerre in the Middle Ages, the wine is dense with tannins as well as the fruit. It should be ready to drink, although it does seem on the dry side.
title: Joseph Mellot 2016 Le Connétable  (Sancerre)

description: A warm-climate Pinot Noir, it's very soft and gentle. It is ripe, with good juicy red fruit flavors and a brush of tannin. Drink now.
title: Le Petit Panier 2016 Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: This wine is dark and structured, offering ripe fruits although they are covered at this stage by the tannins. Firm and dense, with a dry core, this will be a powerful wine full of black fruits and concentration. Drink this from 2023.
title: Louis Latour 2018  Grands-Echezeaux

description: This château in the middle of the Clos de Vougeot claims fame as the only winery situated inside the walls of this fabled vineyard. This ripe, rich and concentrated wine is full of jammy strawberry fruits that are deepened by the wood aging. The structure and the density of this wine show that it will age well. Drink from 2023.
title: Château de la Tour 2017  Clos de Vougeot

description: First recorded in 1375, this vineyard produces powerful, concentrated wines. This fine example is dense, weighty and firm. The acidity is there, buried in the firm tannins. It is a wine with an enormous potential, dark and full of plum skin and berries. Drink from 2022.
designation: Clos de la Vigne au Saint
title: Louis Latour 2018 Clos de la Vigne au Saint  (Corton)
title_short: 2018 Clos de la Vigne au Saint  (Corton)

description: Structured and dense, this wine comes from the remains of a quarry on the hill of Corton. From the Louis Latour domaine, it is powerful and packed with black fruits, rich while still with the freshness of the year. It has a good future, so don't drink before 2023.
title: Louis Latour 2018  Corton Perrières

description: Stéphane Brocard is based in Marsannay the northernmost vineyard in Burgundy's Côte d'Or. This wine comes from two small parcels with 35-year-old vines. It is already fruity and attractive, although the tannins do promise aging. Crisp with the pure acidity of the vintage, it will develop well and should be drunk from late 2021.
title: Maison Stéphane Brocard 2018 Closerie des Alisiers Vieilles Vignes  (Marsannay)

description: This is a light-colored wine, with structure and acidity to balance the perfumed cherry-flavored fruit. Still young, still developing its fruitiness, the wine is going to be crisp with attractive strawberry flavors and soft tannins. Drink from 2023.
title: Domaine Chevillon-Chezeaux 2018 Aux Champs Perdrix Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: Rounded and soft, with gentle tannins. Packed with black cherry fruits, a herbal edge and sweetness, this is already an approachable wine, fruity and generous.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2013  Santenay

description: Produced in this village in the hills behind the main slope of the Côte de Beaune, this wine is smooth and rich. Fine, soft tannins easily integrate into the sweet texture and red-plum fruit. The acidity is there, giving a wine that is both fresh and generous. Drink from 2022.
title: Louis Latour 2018  Monthélie

description: This wine has intense acidity along with red fruits, showing the freshness of the year. A smoky, burnt character from the wood aging needs to integrate, with a youthful crispness that needs to soften. Drink from 2024.
title: Domaine Jean Monnier et Fils 2018 Les Montrevenots Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: With its juicy, strawberry-like acidity, smoky character and firm tannins, this is already well developed and delicious. The finish brings out crispness and fragrance.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2014  Mercurey

description: This is concentrated, with black plum and damson flavors that are balanced by firm, dense tannins. It has a dry, solid core, with a more perfumed character that merges with the acidity.
title: Domaine Heresztyn 2014 Vieilles Vignes  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: A foursquare, solid wine that shows its structure right up front. It is backed by red fruits and acids that lend a warm feeling. Full and dense, this needs to age.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2013  Nuits-St.-Georges

description: This wine is so light, all bright fruit and crisp acidity. A stalky, herbal element contrasts with the red currant fruit flavors. The wine could be better from 2020.
title: Vignerons de Buxy 2017 Buissonnier  (Mercurey)

description: The wine has layers of the acidity typical of the vintage. For fruit it is juicy with tight red-currant flavors and more of that intense acidity. The wine probably needs to calm down and so will be better from 2021.
title: Vignerons de Buxy 2018 Buissonnier Pinot Noir  (Côte Chalonnaise)

description: This is a light and very fruity wine from vineyards in the hills above Nuits Saint-Georges. It has just fruit, light tannins and considerable acidity. The wine is crisp, bright and will be ready to drink from 2021.
title: Domaine Chevillon-Chezeaux 2018  Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits

description: This wine is soft and rather shapeless. It has red fruits and a gentle texture while lacking in depth. It's a simple wine that will develop quickly.
title: Labouré-Roi 2018  Chambolle-Musigny

description: Some flint hovers above the glass and leads to a simple but pepper-spicy body that is light and very crisp. Drink this simple wine soon.
title: Domaine Pfister 2018 Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: For a wine from this appellation, this is soft, bringing out ripe fruit rather than structure. It means the wine will develop quickly and with charm as well as richness. The red fruits are already showing well, as is crisp acidity. Drink from 2022.
title: Château de Santenay 2018  Nuits-St.-Georges

description: From the Louis Latour domaine, this rich wine is lightly touched with wood. It has red-plum flavors and ripe acidity, with the structure embedded in the fruits. Drink from 2023.
title: Louis Latour 2018  Aloxe-Corton

description: Ripe and fruity with a velvet texture that encompasses the tannins easily, this is a rounded, rich wine. The balance of fruit and acidity is already attractive. Drink from 2022.
title: Louis Latour 2018  Savigny-lès-Beaune

description: Smooth, velvet-textured wine. It tastes like munching into mouthwatering black cherries. The acidity is important but not overwhelming. Ready to drink now.
title: Roger et Didier Raimbault 2012 Rouge  (Sancerre)

description: Rich and dense, this concentrated wine has a fine, smooth texture that is ripe with red-berry fruits. The freshness of the vintage comes through in the acidity and crisp, taut texture. The wine will be ready to drink from 2024, the 800th anniversary of the oldest-known traces of this vineyard.
designation: Clos de la Mousse Premier Cru
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2018 Clos de la Mousse Premier Cru  (Beaune)
title_short: 2018 Clos de la Mousse Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: This structured wine is firm at this early stage, with tannins and a touch of bitter-chocolate extraction that needs to diminish before the black fruits get their chance. Keep this dark, solid wine until 2022.
title: Château de Santenay 2018 Les Pruliers Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: This is a ripe wine. Red plum and berry fruits are given weight and richness by the solid tannins, smoky flavors and the dryness at the heart of the wine. Give this structured wine time to develop and drink from 2021.
title: Albert Morot 2018 Les Toussaints Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: Attractively perfumed, this rich wine offers some dark tannins as well as forward black-currant fruits. The wood aging is still showing in the burnt toastiness of the wine, although this will diminish, leaving a broad wine packed with fruit. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine de Suremain 2018 La Bondue Premier Cru  (Mercurey)

description: Packed with red fruits, this wine has great potential, with attractive wild-strawberry fruits that are fresh and perfumed. Behind this fruitiness, the wine is tight and structured. It will be round, rich and ready to drink from 2023.
title: Domaine Pierre Labet 2017 Coucherias Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: The texture and structure of this wine may be light but the fruitiness is so appealing. Soft and ripe with red-berry fruit flavors and refreshing acidity, it will develop quickly and be ready to drink from 2021.
title: Maurice Ecard 2017 Les Serpentières Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: A tannins-dominated wine, firm and dry. The fruit is relatively subdued, with a juicy character of raspberries, red plum skins and crisp acidity. This is a wine that needs aging to soften those tannins: give it 4–5 years.
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2011 Aux Malconsorts Premier Cru  (Vosne-Romanée)

description: A solid wine, showing some generosity and richness, the fruits displaying a fine balance between sweetness, dry tannins and bright acidity. It has some of the sensuous character of good Volnay, opening into ripeness. Worth aging for several years, but already offering considerable pleasure.
designation: Caillerets Premier Cru Ancienne Cuvée Carnot
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2011 Caillerets Premier Cru Ancienne Cuvée Carnot  (Volnay)
title_short: 2011 Caillerets Premier Cru Ancienne Cuvée Carnot  (Volnay)

description: This smoky wine is ripe with a fine balance between tannins and rich red fruits. It is warm, rounded and attractively spicy. The structure and dry core will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Françoise André 2019 Les Vergelsess Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: As always with a grand cru from Gevrey-Chambertin, this wine shows immense power. It is dominated by black fruits as well as signs of the 60% wood aging. Behind, the red cherry fruits are developing along with the lively acidity. It needs to age and should not be drunk before 2023.
title: Roche de Bellene 2016  Charmes-Chambertin

description: A ripe and rich wine, this is full of jammy red fruits. The structure is well integrated into the fruits, giving a smooth, ripe wine that's developing attractively. With a juicy, fresh aftertaste, it is ready to drink, although it will be better from 2021.
title: Roger et Didier Raimbault 2018  Sancerre

description: The initial impression is of toast and spice. Only slowly do the fruit and full-bodied richness of this wine become apparent. It comes from a Grand Cru close to Corton-Charlemagne and has similar structure and power. The wine will develop slowly and richly. Drink it from 2024.
title: Domaine Maillard 2017  Corton

description: This is a concentrated wine, full with dry tannins and perfumed red fruits. Hints of the wood aging give the wine toast and smokiness. The fresh fruits form a contrast offering a future of fragrance and stylishness. It needs to age, so wait until 2023.
title: Château de Santenay 2016 Montée Rouge Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: With bitter cherry flavor and a light touch of tannin, this is a fruity, spicy wine. It has a cool climate feel of acidity and tight texture, while also being light and fresh. Drink now.
title: Sipp Mack 2015 Tradition Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: This single-parcel, partially barrel-fermented Champagne is in effect a Blanc de Noirs. If all that sounds complicated (and so does the name of the wine), the wine itself is much easier to appreciate. It is certainly rich, with a touch of tannin and mineral texture. Full of ripe white fruits, it offers good acidity at the end. It could age longer; drink from 2021.
designation: Fins Lieux No 1 Millésimé Grand Cru Brut
title: Pehu-Simonet 2014 Fins Lieux No 1 Millésimé Grand Cru Brut Pinot Noir (Champagne)
title_short: 2014 Fins Lieux No 1 Millésimé Grand Cru Brut Pinot Noir (Champagne)

description: Close to Sancerre, Menetou-Salon produces a soft style of Pinot Noir, the acidity tamed by fresh tannins and loganberry fruits. A hint of wood gives extra weight.
title: Xavier Flouret 2010 Domaine de Châtenoy Rouge Noir  (Menetou-Salon)

description: Big, juicy fruit, bolstered by tannins, gives this wine weight and impressive structure. There is a dry core surrounded by ripe plums, herbs and fresh spices , resulting in soft, juicy freshness. But those tannins promise aging potential.
title: Domaine Moillard 2009 Beaux-Monts Premier Cru  (Vosne-Romanée)

description: Initially earthy aromas give way to red fruits. The wine follows the same pattern, the barnyard flavors opening out with the ripe red plum and strawberry fruits. There is a delicious richness here, balanced with acidity and firm tannins.
title: Pierre Morey 2009 Santenots Premier Cru  (Volnay)

description: This wine is generous, rounded and soft. Rich red fruits dominate, exploding in the mouth with red cherry and raspberry flavors. It is a soft wine, perfumed with delicious, forward fruitiness. Drink from 2021.
title: Alex Gambal 2017  Chambolle-Musigny

description: Soft tannins and a rounded texture make this wine almost drinkable now. The smooth structure only slowly shows tannins and acidity. A fresh, raspberry fruit character will allow the wine to develop. Drink now, although better from 2021.
title: Henri de Villamont 2016 Clos des Guettes Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: This is a ripe and fruity wine. Soft, generous tannins are embedded in the developing red-fruit flavors. With spice, hints of the wood aging and a rich texture, the wine will develop relatively quickly. Drink from 2024.
title: Louis Latour 2018  Echézeaux

description: Bold brush strokes characterize this wine, the fruit a complex mélange of red berries, acidity and weight. The wine has good density, offering a strawberry jam character to go with the fresh edge. Tannins are enveloped in the fruits, promising medium-term aging.
designation: Clos de la Mousse Premier Cru
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2011 Clos de la Mousse Premier Cru  (Beaune)
title_short: 2011 Clos de la Mousse Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: One of Bouchard's signature wines, this is beautifully textured, a series of bright fruits, strawberries and sweet acidity. There are tannins, but this is lighter than in some vintages, a wine for short-term aging.
designation: Beaune Grèves Premier Cru Vigne de l'Enfant Jésus
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2011 Beaune Grèves Premier Cru Vigne de l'Enfant Jésus  (Beaune)
title_short: 2011 Beaune Grèves Premier Cru Vigne de l'Enfant Jésus  (Beaune)

description: An already complete wine, the tannins well integrated into the firm black fruits and acidity. It is foursquare but also has a richness that comes from wood as well as lively final freshness.
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2011 Les Cailles Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: A solid structure and layers of dense fruit characterize this wine. Rich acidity, red cherry flavor and a dry, dark tannic core are surrounded by juicy red berry fruits and the freshest finish.
title: Camille Giroud 2012 Charmes Chambertin  (Charmes-Chambertin)

description: An intense and concentrated wine, with dense black fruits balanced by acidity. There is ripeness here, with a firm, ageworthy structure as well as delicious juicy Pinot Noir character.
title: Louis Latour 2013 Château Corton Grancey  (Corton)

description: This is deliciously hedonistic in the best traditions of Volnay, opulent and powered with flavors of blackberry jelly, dry tannins and perfumed violets. This is a big, ripe, solid wine whose perfumes give an enticing exotic aftertaste.
title: Roux Père et Fils 2008 Les Santenots Premier Cru  (Volnay)

description: A firm and tannic wine, this has dry spices, dark fruits and concentration. Great depth of flavor gives a serious wine that also has a fruit-driven profile. Concentrated dark tannins push this wine to a great height and impressive length. Drink from 2024.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2016  Grands-Echezeaux

description: Packed with tannins and boasting an enormous structure, this wine is opulent while very firm. At the same time, smoky acidity shoots through all this density. From a great terroir, this wine shows minerality and its great structure well. Drink from 2023.
title: Louis Jadot 2017  Chapelle-Chambertin

description: This wine is perfumed with gorgeous fruit that contrasts with the strict minerality. The tannins under the fruit are severe, solid, dark and promising enormous potential. Concentrated even while it celebrates great fruit, it is going to last for many years. Drink from 2023.
title: Louis Jadot 2017  Chambertin Clos de Bèze

description: This offers a firm, dense structure, with dark tannins and big, ripe, opulent fruits. At the same time the elegance that is the hallmark of the domaine is equally present with stylish red fruits and a velvet texture. The wine needs to age to be at its peak, although it is beautiful now. Drink from 2024.
title: Domaine Jean Grivot 2017  Clos de Vougeot

description: Big and bold with great strawberry and red cherry flavors, this wine has all the elements of dense fruit, intense acidity and rich tannins. The structure is dark and full of potential. With acidity at the end to give a lift of freshness, this is a wine for the long-term. Drink from 2024.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2016 Petit Monts Premier Cru  (Vosne-Romanée)

description: A more serious attempt at crafting a good Pinot Noir in Languedoc-Roussillon and quite a successful one as well. Vanilla dominates the nose but yields to cherry pie filling and cherry jam flavors in the mouth. Mineral and strawberry notes shine through on the crisp, moderately long finish.
title: Gérard Bertrand 2010 Réserve Spéciale Pinot Noir (Vin de Pays d'Oc)
title_short: 2010 Réserve Spéciale Pinot Noir (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: The vineyards of the 13th century abbey of La Ferté produces some of the best Givry. This wine has great structure with firm tannins, and also rich, juicy fruitiness that offers delicious acidity and a more solid base for aging. Drink from 2020.
designation: Clos du Cellier aux Moines Premier Cru
title: Domaines Devillard 2015 Clos du Cellier aux Moines Premier Cru  (Givry)
title_short: 2015 Clos du Cellier aux Moines Premier Cru  (Givry)

description: This is a blend of Pinot Noir from Burgundy and the south of France, giving a warm and rich character with soft tannins and juicy red plum fruit flavors. Cherry and fresh acidity complete this attractive, easy wine.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2016 Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: This ripe, fruity wine is ready to drink. With red berry fruits and fresh acidity spiced with wood flavors, it's an easy wine that is ripe and soft.
title: Patient Cottat 2016 Le Grand Caillou Pinot Noir (Vin de France)
title_short: 2016 Le Grand Caillou Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: This light, fresh wine, with its concentration on raspberry flavors, has lifted acidity and an edge of bitterness. The tannins are there, but relatively subdued, so it's likely to age quickly.
title: Louis Latour 2009  Morey-Saint-Denis

description: A fruity wine, just touched by some wood aging with attractive strawberry fruit flavors and acidity. It's not a wine for aging, its light minerality enhancing the fruitiness.
title: Domaines Devillard 2015 Le Renard  (Bourgogne)

description: Very easy, slightly confected cherry fruit comes immediately to the fore. The palate has the same candy-ish notion countered with lots of freshness. The body is light, translucent and off dry. Drink soon while berryish aromas are at their peak.
title: Domaine Robert Klingenfus 2019 Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: The nose is rather closed and just hints at crunchy cherries. The palate has ample red-cherry fruit but lacks a little definition and sports a slightly bitter edge. The body is dry and juicy. Drink soon.
title: Domaine Fernand Engel 2019 Meyerhof Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: Rather stalky, this dry wine has a sense of extraction in the form of bitterness. The wine's red fruits are behind this dryness, demanding at least another 2–3 years.
title: Joseph Mellot 2016 Clos du Pressoir  (Menetou-Salon)

description: This lean wine focuses more on its stalky texture rather than fruit. It has some attractive perfumes and hints of red fruits that are subdued by the austere structure. Drink from 2021.
title: Roland Tissier et Fils 2018 Tradition  (Sancerre)

description: While the wine is ripe, it does have a barnyard aroma that needs to blow away before it is ready to drink. The aroma comes with firm, dry tannins and a ripe berry fruits that are just beginning to develop. Drink from 2021.
title: Clement et Florian Berthier 2018 Pinot Noir (Coteaux du Giennois)

description: This is a ripe wine, packing tannins as well as black fruits into a rich package. Black cherries and black plums are paired with a core of dry tannins. The acidity comes right through to give the wine its potential. The wine comes from a very stony vineyard and this shows in its tight mineral aftertaste. Drink from 2023.
designation: Château de Chamirey En Sazenay Premier Cru
title: Domaines Devillard 2018 Château de Chamirey En Sazenay Premier Cru  (Mercurey)
title_short: 2018 Château de Chamirey En Sazenay Premier Cru  (Mercurey)

description: It is rare to find mature red Burgundy being sold directly from the producer's cellar. This 2012 from an above-average vintage is certainly showing signs of rich maturity. It has developed the undergrowth aromas and spice flavors of ready-to-drink Pinot Noir. It has also retained plenty of acidity. It is a lightly tannic wine that is ready to drink.
title: Capitain-Gagnerot 2012 Les Moutottes Premier Cru  (Aloxe-Corton)

description: There is plenty of the power and structure of a Vosne-Romanée in this single parcel wine. It has density and concentration over a rich full black-fruit character. There are still signs of the wood aging and some high toast flavors that need to integrate, so wait until 2024.
title: Domaine de Bellene 2018 Les Quartiers de Nuits  (Vosne-Romanée)

description: A single-vineyard wine, this is firmly structured and full of perfumed fruit. New wood aging gives the red berry fruit a smoky, toasty character. It's a rich, concentrated selection to age for five years or more.
title: Domaine des Varoilles 2014 Clos du Meix des Ouches  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: This is a smooth and polished wine, with herb and new wood aromas. It has juicy red-berry flavors, and the tannins push forward. Structured, with intense acidity, this is ready to age for at least 5–6 years.
title: Domaine Jessiaume 2014 Gravières Premier Cru  (Santenay)

description: An old-vine wine, this is powerful, concentrated and impressively dense for a Marsannay. It is full of red plum and berry flavors, plus firm tannins that suggest this could age for several years.
title: Domaine Sylvain Pataille 2014 L'Ancestrale  (Marsannay)
